summary: This is a letter from defense counsel Laura A. Menninger to Judge Alison J. Nathan regarding proposed redactions to pleadings in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The letter discusses redacting references to a third-party witness facing criminal charges in France, derived from a government document marked 'Confidential'.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: Presiding judge in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, recipient of this letter regarding redactions to pleadings.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, whose counsel is seeking redactions to protect a third-party witness.

persons.name: Laura A. Menninger
persons.context: Attorney from Haddon, Morgan and Foreman representing Ghislaine Maxwell, author of this letter to Judge Nathan regarding redactions.

persons.name: Ms. McCawley
persons.context: Attorney with Boies Schiller & Flexner (BSF) who was involved in email correspondence with the government regarding confidential materials.

connections.description: Menninger is defense counsel representing Maxwell in the criminal case, as indicated by her filing this letter on Maxwell's behalf.
Nathan is the presiding judge in Maxwell's criminal case, overseeing procedural matters including redaction requests.
Both are attorneys involved in the case; Menninger's letter references conferring with McCawley's firm (BSF) regarding proposed redactions.

events.title: Defendant's Response Filed
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team filed a response regarding Rule 17(c) subpoenas, which contained references to a confidential witness.

events.title: BSF's Reply Filed
events.description: Boies Schiller & Flexner filed a reply regarding the Rule 17(c) subpoenas, also containing references to the same confidential witness.

events.title: Redaction Request Letter
events.description: Defense counsel Laura Menninger writes to Judge Nathan requesting redactions of a third-party witness's name and description from previously filed pleadings.

locations: United States District Court, Southern District of New York, 500 Pearl Street, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Defense counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell is seeking to redact two references to a third-party witness's name and description from pleadings filed on April 2 and April 5, 2021.
The information to be redacted was derived from a government document marked 'Confidential'.
The third-party witness is facing criminal charges in France on matters related to the Epstein/Maxwell case.
The government previously redacted this individual's name from its Omnibus Response and an email between the government and attorney Ms. McCawley.
Boies Schiller & Flexner (BSF) takes no position on whether the proposed redactions are necessary, citing lack of knowledge about exchanged materials.
